title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (The repression of the desires) Colour's five hues from the eyes their sight will take;
Music's five notes the ears as deaf can make;
The flavours five deprive the mouth of taste;
The chariot course, and the wild hunting waste make mad the mind;
and objects rare and strange, sought for, men's conduct will to evil change.

passages.zh: 是以聖人為腹不為目，故去彼取此。
passages.en: Therefore the sage seeks to satisfy (the craving of) the belly, and not the (insatiable longing of the) eyes. He puts from him the latter, and prefers to seek the former.
